abstract: Pedro Leonardo Mascheroni, former scientist at the Los Alamos National Laboratory, is sentenced to five years in prison for passing secret nuclear weapons data to a person he believed to be a Venezuelan government official.
lead_paragraph: A former scientist at the Los Alamos National Laboratory was sentenced Wednesday to five years in prison for passing secret nuclear weapons data to a person he believed to be a Venezuelan government official, the F.B.I. said.
snippet: A former scientist at the Los Alamos National Laboratory was sentenced Wednesday to five years in prison for passing secret nuclear weapons data to a person he believed to be a Venezuelan government official, the F.B.I. said.

headline.main: New Mexico: Physicist Is Sentenced in a Spy Case
headline.print_headline: New Mexico: Physicist Is Sentenced in a Spy Case
